name: NFQ1 - IPv4 Length
description:
How many bits are in an IPv4 address?
A. 16
B. 32
C. 64
D. 128

name: NFQ2 - OSI Layers
description:
How many layers are in the OSI model?
A. 5
B. 6
C. 7
D. 4

name: NFQ3 - DHCP Acronym
description:
What does the acronym DORA stand for in DHCP?
A. Discover, Offer, Request, Acknowledgment
B. Detect, Offer, Response, Action
C. Deploy, Obtain, Request, Accept
D. Direct, Order, Respond, Allocate

name: NFQ4 - DNS Port
description:
What port does DNS typically use?
A. 80
B. 22
C. 53
D. 443

name: NFQ5 - MAC Address Length
description:
How many bits are in a MAC address?
A. 32
B. 64
C. 128
D. 48

name: NFQ6 - IP Class
description:
An IP address starting with 192 belongs to which class?
A. Class A
B. Class B
C. Class C
D. Class D

name: NFQ7 - OSI Encryption Layer
description:
Which OSI layer handles encryption?
A. Application
B. Session
C. Transport
D. Presentation

name: NFQ8 - TCP vs UDP
description:
Which of the following is true about TCP?
A. It is unreliable
B. It uses fewer headers
C. It establishes a connection before sending data
D. It is faster than UDP

name: NFQ9 - IPv6 Length
description:
How many bits are in an IPv6 address?
A. 32
B. 64
C. 128
D. 256

name: NFQ10 - Ethernet Standard
description:
Which IEEE standard defines Ethernet?
A. 802.11
B. 802.15
C. 802.3
D. 802.1x
